sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"仪器，设备，器械，器具"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: apparatus, instrument, device, equipment, tool, implement, installation, appliance, facilities
means: apparatus ：既可指某种具体的由许多不同零件构成的复杂的仪器、装置或器械，又可指它们的总称。
instrument ：通常指能使人们完成某一精确动作或测量的一种小型仪器，尤指电工仪表、测量装置，航海或航空用的控制装置。
device ：多指为某一特殊用途或解决某一特定机械问题而设计或改装的精巧的仪器或装置。
equipment ：多指成套的或重型的设备或装备。通常用作不可数名词。
tool ：一般指进行特种工作的手工工具，也可指人造使用动力的工具，还可作引申用。
implement ：原指史前人类所用的工具，现在多指农用工具，也可指为实现某个任务所需的工具或器具。
installation ：一般多指安装完成，可供使用或操作的整套装置或设施。
appliance ：侧重指家用机器或设备，尤指家用电器。
facilities ：常用复数形式，指可供使用的设备或设施。

sentence.Network_en: An instrument called a trocar makes a puncture in the abdominal wall.
sentence.Network_cn: 一种叫做套管针的工具在腹壁上刺了一个孔。

sentence.Network_en: The veto has been a traditional instrument of diplomacy for centuries.
sentence.Network_cn: 几个世纪以来否决权一直是外交上惯用的手段。

sentence.Network_en: There is an internal circuit breaker to protect the instrument from overload.
sentence.Network_cn: 内置有断路器，防止设备过载。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin instrumentum 'equipment, implement', from the verb instruere 'construct, equip'

entry.def: An instrument is a tool or device that is used to do a particular task, especially a scientific task.

example.tran: 试管状的细长光学仪器
清洗和抛光牙齿的器械

entry.def: A musical instrument is an object such as a piano, guitar, or flute, which you play in order to produce music.

example.ex: Learning a musical instrument introduces a child to an understanding of music.
example.tran: 学一门乐器能引导孩子了解音乐。

entry.def: An instrument is a device that is used for making measurements of something such as speed, height, or sound, for example on a ship or plane or in a car.

example.tran: 控制面板上的重要仪表

entry.tran: 工具;手段;被他人利用的人
entry.def: Something that is an instrument for achieving a particular aim is used by people to achieve that aim.

example.ex: The veto has been a traditional instrument of diplomacy for centuries.
example.tran: 几个世纪以来否决权一直是外交上惯用的手段。

means.word_mean: 1. a device that requires skill for proper use
2. the means whereby some act is accomplished;

sentences.sentence: "my greed was the instrument of my destruction"
"science has given us new tools to fight disease"

means.word_mean: 3. a person used by another to gain an end
4. (law) a document that states some contractual relationship or grants some right
5. the semantic role of the entity (usually inanimate) that the agent uses to perform an action or start a process
6. any of various devices or contrivances that can be used to produce musical tones or sounds
1. equip with instruments for measuring, recording, or controlling

auth_sentence.content: You can play all the notes on either instrument.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: You can play all the notes on either instrument.

auth_sentence.res_content: Construction on the one-billion dollar instrument begins next year.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Construction on the one-billion dollar instrument begins next year.

auth_sentence.content: It wasn't simply an instrument for beating you.
auth_sentence.res_content: It wasn't simply an instrument for beating you.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It wasn't simply an instrument for beating you.

stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉,变坏+struct建立,结构→adj.破坏的 n.故意或有计划的破坏 v.破坏

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可破坏的, 易毁坏的

destruct破坏+ive……的→adj.破坏性
industry工业, 产业+ial……的→industrial
industry勤奋+ious..的→industrious
instruct[v.教,教授;命令,指示]+ive表形容词→adj.有益的, 教育性的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 仪器的;器械的;乐器的;起作用的;有帮助的
stems_affixes.word_buile: instrument[n.工具,仪器,器械;乐器]+al……的→adj.仪器的;器械的;乐器的;起作用的;有帮助的
obstruct[v.阻隔,阻塞[道路,通道等]n.阻碍物,障碍物]+ion表名词→n.妨碍,障碍物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 建造,构造;建筑物,结构;释义,解释
stems_affixes.word_buile: construct[v.建设,建造,构造;创立]+ion表名词→n.建造,构造;建筑物,结构;释义,解释
de去掉,变坏+struct建立,结构→adj.破坏的 n.故意或有计划的破坏 v.破坏
destruct破坏+ion表名词→弄坏结构→破坏

stems_affixes.value_cn: 工业, 产业, 行业, 勤奋
stems_affixes.word_buile: indu=in+str=struct建立,结构+y→n.工业, 产业, 行业, 勤奋
instruct[v.教,教授;命令,指示]+ion表名词→n.教授;指导;[n.]用法说明[书],操作指南
instruct[v.教,教授;命令,指示]+or人→n.指导者,教员
in内+stru=struct建立,结构+ment物→内部构造→仪器,工具
instrumental[adj.仪器的;器械的;乐器的;起作用的;有帮助的]+ity性质→n.手段
ob反+struct建立,结构→反建设→阻塞,阻碍
struct建立,结构+ure表名词→n.结构,构造;建筑物 v.构造,建造

stems_affixes.value_cn: 基础,下部结构,地下建筑

con共同+struct建立,结构→共同建立→建设,建造
de坏+stroy=struct建立,结构→v.破坏,摧毁,消灭
de去掉,变坏+struct建立,结构→adj.破坏的 n.故意或有计划的破坏 v.破坏
in进+struct建立,结构→把知识建立进去→指导,指示
ob反+struct建立,结构→反建设→阻塞,阻碍
re再+construct[v.建设,建造,构造;创立]→v.重建,再建;重现,再现
struct建立,结构+ure表名词→n.结构,构造;建筑物 v.构造,建造

Sentence.sentence: Over the next two years they made their most groundbreaking work, turning the recording studio into a magical instrument of its own.
When performing, he positions his instruments in a way that is deliberately inconvenient, so that switching from guitar to organ mid-song involves a mad dash across the stage.
With creativity, even old-fashioned instruments may produce spectacular sound effects

jushi.english: All surgical instruments must be sterilized before use.
jushi.chinese: 所有的外科手术器械在使用之前,必须消毒。

jushi.english: The pilot studied his instruments anxiously.
jushi.chinese: 飞行员焦虑地把他的各种仪器仔细查看了一番。

jushi.english: He did not himself kill the prisoner; the jailer was his instrument in the murder.
jushi.chinese: 他没有亲手杀死犯人,监狱看守在这起凶杀案中充当了他的工具。
